working_definition: Emotional Disturbance is a condition exhibiting one or more of the following characteristics over a long period of time and to a marked degree that adversely affects educational performance: (1) an inability to learn not explained by intellectual, sensory, or health factors; (2) an inability to build or maintain satisfactory interpersonal relationships with peers and teachers; (3) inappropriate types of behavior or feelings under normal circumstances; (4) a general pervasive mood of unhappiness or depression; (5) a tendency to develop physical symptoms or fears associated with personal or school problems.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Anxiety Disorders
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: Conditions involving excessive fear, worry, or uneasiness that affect school participation.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Depression
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A mood disorder that can impact energy, concentration, and social relationships.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Oppositional Defiant Disorder (ODD)
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A behavioral disorder involving a pattern of uncooperative and defiant behavior toward authority figures.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Conduct Disorder
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A serious behavioral and emotional disorder involving rule-breaking, aggression, and disregard for social norms.

other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.name: Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD)
other_names_or_examples_with_definitions.definition: A disorder triggered by experiencing or witnessing a traumatic event, affecting behavior, emotions, and learning.

common_presentations: Withdrawal from peers or refusal to participate
Frequent absences or avoidance of school
Low frustration tolerance and quick escalation

accommodations_modifications.name: Behavior intervention plan (BIP)
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Provides consistent strategies and supports for managing challenging behavior
accommodations_modifications.example: Student receives check-ins and rewards for using coping strategies

accommodations_modifications.name: Scheduled mental health counseling
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Supports emotional regulation and processing of feelings
accommodations_modifications.example: Student meets weekly with the school social worker

accommodations_modifications.name: Safe or calming space
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reduces escalation by providing a place to cool down
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Low frustration tolerance and quick escalation
accommodations_modifications.example: Student takes a 5-minute break in the calm corner when overwhelmed

accommodations_modifications.name: Check-in/check-out with staff member
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Builds adult connection and provides structure for transitions
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Frequent absences or avoidance of school
accommodations_modifications.example: Student checks in with a trusted adult at arrival and before dismissal

accommodations_modifications.name: Peer mentoring or lunch buddy programs
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Promotes connection and positive social interaction
accommodations_modifications.addresses_presentation: Withdrawal from peers or refusal to participate
accommodations_modifications.example: Student eats lunch with a trained peer mentor twice a week

accommodations_modifications.name: Visual behavior expectations and reminders
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reinforces appropriate behavior in a nonverbal way
accommodations_modifications.example: Student has a desk chart with pictures of classroom rules

accommodations_modifications.name: Frequent, specific praise for positive behavior
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reinforces desired actions and builds self-esteem
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher praises effort and cooperation during group work

accommodations_modifications.name: Modified workload or alternative assignments
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Reduces stress and supports emotional regulation
accommodations_modifications.example: Student completes five math problems instead of ten

accommodations_modifications.name: Social-emotional learning (SEL) curriculum
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Teaches self-awareness, emotion management, and relationship skills
accommodations_modifications.example: Student participates in weekly SEL group lessons

accommodations_modifications.name: Private cueing or prompts before correction
accommodations_modifications.how_it_helps: Helps students adjust behavior without embarrassment
accommodations_modifications.example: Teacher taps desk gently to remind student of expectations
